data.text: O Lord, Father and Master of my life,
Who will set scourges over my thought,
That mine ignorances be not multiplied,
O Lord, Father and God of my life,
And turn away concupiscense from me. The remainder of this verse is omitted by the best authorities.
Let not Gr. appetite of the belly.  greediness and chambering overtake me;
Hear ye, my children, the discipline of the mouth;
The sinner shall be Most authorities read left.  overtaken in his lips;
Accustom not thy mouth to an oath;
For as a servant that is continually scourged shall not lack a bruise,
A man of many oaths shall be filled with iniquity;
There is a manner of speech that is clothed about with death:
Accustom not thy mouth to gross rudeness,
Remember thy father and thy mother,
A man that is accustomed to words of reproach
Two sorts of men  multiply sins,
All bread is sweet to a fornicator:
A man that goeth astray from his own bed,
- And the eyes of men are his terror,
All things were known unto him or ever they were created;
This man shall be punished in the streets of the city;
So also a wife that leaveth her husband,
For first, she was disobedient in the law of the Most High;
She shall be brought out into the congregation;
Her children shall not spread into roots,
She shall leave her memory for a curse;
And they that are left behind shall know that there is nothing better than the fear of the Lord,
Verse 28 is omitted by the best authorities.
